awd_titl_txt: Research Initiation Grants:  Optimal Design Synthesis of    Dynamic Structural Modification Elements
awd_abstract_narration: The objectives of this proposed research are twofold:                           1) to investigate the impact of high spatial density dynamic                    measurement and rotational degrees-of-freedom measurement on                    dynamic structural modification, 2) to develop an optimal degrees               of freedom in the experimentally derived dynamic model.  This work              will result in a more informationally complete dynamics model which             should be able to predict the response of proposed modifications                on the structure.  The modifications to the structure will be                   realized by synthesizing a structural element that generates the                desired response based on prescribed design goals and constraints.              Results from the field of structural optimization will be applied               to the experimental dynamics model to make the design trade-offs.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation

inst.inst_name: Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University
